intro: Thrincia nudicalyx, commonly known as the naked-seed thrincia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Thrincia nudicalyx is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
